name: Barringer Iceberg
uniques: Comment [Adjacent units ending their turn take 100 damage]
Grants [Titanicly] ([ship is sunken]) to adjacent [All] units for the rest of the game
Must be adjacent to [6] [Water] tiles
Occurs on latitudes from [70] to [100] percent of distance equator to pole
Must be adjacent to [1] to [6] [Coast] tiles

civilopediaText.text: The silent killer, the lord of the cold polar sea. No matter how big, no ship has ever survived an encounter with the biggest iceberg of all.
Parody of the Barringer Crater

name: Dead Plains
uniques: Must be adjacent to [6] [Water] tiles
Must be adjacent to [1] to [6] [Coast] tiles
Occurs in groups of [2] to [2] tiles
Units ending their turn on this terrain take [50] damage

civilopediaText.text: Its not the dead sea, its an island so salty, that barely anything can live there.
Parody of the Dead Sea

name: Demon Falls
uniques: Must be adjacent to [1] to [6] [Coast] tiles
Must be adjacent to [0] [Ice] tiles
Neighboring tiles will convert to [Coast]

civilopediaText.text: So peculiar, a tiny waterfall, in a tiny island, a tiny rock. Where does the fresh water comes from?
Parody of the Angel Falls

name: El Mojado
uniques: Must be adjacent to [0] [Coast] tiles
Must be adjacent to [6] to [6] [Ocean] tiles
Grants 500 Gold to the first civilization to discover it
Tile provides yield without assigned population
Has an elevation of [3] for visibility calculations

civilopediaText.text: The city of gold, who many merchants and sailors set to explore, deep in the amazonian sea, where from many have not returned.
Parody of El Dorado

name: Everest Deep
uniques: Must be adjacent to [0] [Coast] tiles
Must be adjacent to [6] to [6] [Ocean] tiles
Tile provides yield without assigned population

civilopediaText.text: With earth's highs and lows, it certain that its not flat. This proves it, as its so deep, humanity will take many centuries to be able to reach the bottom.
Parody of Mount Everest

name: Eye of the Sahara Sea
uniques: Must be adjacent to [6] [Water] tiles

civilopediaText.text: Mariners who saw it are labeled as crazy, but they'll never forgotten what they actually did see.
Parody of the Eye of the Sahara

name: Floating Moss
uniques: Must be adjacent to [6] [Water] tiles
Must be adjacent to [0] [Ice] tiles
Must be adjacent to [1] to [6] [Coast] tiles

civilopediaText.text: An island, yet not land. An island full of monkeys and weird fruit. An island, navigating the seas, never to be seen.
Parody of the Pantanal

name: Galapagos Seas
uniques: Must be adjacent to [1] [Coast] tiles
Must be adjacent to [5] [Land] tiles
Occurs on latitudes from [1] to [20] percent of distance equator to pole

civilopediaText.text: Fascinating collection of inner seas, where evolutuanry processes inspired scientist to learn more about nature.
Parody of the Galapagos Archipelago

name: Grand Underwater Mesa
uniques: Must be adjacent to [1] [Coast] tiles
Units ending their turn on this terrain take [50] damage

civilopediaText.text: Officially the lowest island of all. Barely under the sea level, a mere 2 meters deep, the place is known for being hard to spot and ship go plop.
Parody of the Grand Mesa

name: Great Atlantis
uniques: Must be adjacent to [0] [Coast] tiles
Units ending their turn on this terrain take [70] damage
Grants 500 Gold to the first civilization to discover it
Must be adjacent to [0] to [3] [Plains] tiles
Must be adjacent to [0] to [3] [Grassland] tiles

civilopediaText.text: And so, blessed by the gods, to be protected from the sinful peoples of the land, the city was risen to the skies. How dumb of them, that they suffocated the atlanteans from lack of oxigen...
Parody of Atlantis

name: Great Barrier Rock
uniques: Must be adjacent to [1] to [5] [Coast] tiles
Must be adjacent to [6] [Land] tiles
Occurs on latitudes from [10] to [70] percent of distance equator to pole
Occurs in groups of [2] to [2] tiles
Blocks line-of-sight from tiles at same elevation

civilopediaText.text: No, its not a mountain, these are quite simply big boulders, home to unique wildlife, not found anywere else.
Parody of the Great Barrier Reef

name: Ha Long Lakes
uniques: Must be adjacent to [1] to [5] [Coast] tiles
Fresh water

civilopediaText.text: The pastures along the lakes have become a popular turist atraction to go picnic.
Parody of the Ha Long Bay

name: Retba Island
uniques: Must be adjacent to [1] to [4] [Coast] tiles

civilopediaText.text: A fantastical island with its unique pink color. Many have tried to buy it, but fortunately no one has been able to.
Parody of the Retba Lake

name: Krakatoa Geyser
uniques: Must be adjacent to [1] to [6] [Coast] tiles
Must be adjacent to [0] [Ice] tiles
Neighboring tiles will convert to [Grassland]

civilopediaText.text: The most powerful geyser on earth, who once erupted hot water so high and so loud, it was heard all over the world and warmed the planet for a few weeks.
Parody of the Krakatoa

name: Lake Fuji
uniques: Must be adjacent to [0] [Coast] tiles
Must be adjacent to [0] [Tundra] tiles
Must be adjacent to [0] [Desert] tiles
Must be adjacent to [0] [Mountain] tiles
Must be adjacent to [0] [Marsh] tiles
Must be adjacent to [0] to [2] [Hill] tiles
Must not be on [1] largest landmasses

civilopediaText.text: A majestic lake, were cherry blossoms blossom, and it's charming water give peace to the soul.
Parody of the Mount Fuji

name: Lake of Gibraltar
uniques: Must be adjacent to [1] to [5] [Land] tiles
Must be adjacent to [1] [Coast] tiles
Neighboring tiles except [Coast] will convert to [Plains]
Occurs on latitudes from [30] to [60] percent of distance equator to pole

civilopediaText.text: Its importance is due to the strategic position for merchants to rest and have fresh water. Famously stolen from the English by the Spanish.
Parody of the Rock of Gibraltar

name: Mariana Chain
uniques: Occurs on latitudes from [10] to [30] percent of distance equator to pole
Neighboring tiles will convert to [Mountain]

civilopediaText.text: The tallest mountain in the whole planet, so high it can reach the stars
Parody of the Mariana Trench

name: Pamukkale Falls
uniques: Must be adjacent to [0] [Coast] tiles
Must be adjacent to [0] [Grassland] tiles
Must be adjacent to [0] [Tundra] tiles
Must be adjacent to [0] [Marsh] tiles
Must be adjacent to [3] to [6] [Plains] tiles

name: Sewer of Illness
uniques: Must be adjacent to [0] [Coast] tiles
Grants [Radioactivity] ([healing decreased by 5]) to adjacent [{Military} {Land}] units for the rest of the game
[+4 Food] <after discovering [Biology]>
[+4 Science] <after discovering [Atomic Theory]>

civilopediaText.text: Anyone who may aproach this cursed waters, will forever be infected of them.
Parody of the Fountain of Youth

name: Sinai Cove
uniques: Must be adjacent to [1] [Desert] tiles
Must be adjacent to [1] to [6] [Coast] tiles

civilopediaText.text: After dividing a mountain in two to escape, Sesom dived down the sea, and there he stayed several days, and God gave him the 20 commandmends for its people.
Parody of Mount Sinai

name: Titicaca Pit
uniques: Must be adjacent to [2] to [6] [Hill] tiles
Must be adjacent to [1] to [6] [Plains] tiles
Must be adjacent to [2] to [6] [Coast] tiles
Neighboring tiles except [Plains] will convert to [Coast]

civilopediaText.text: ''Land ahoy!' I said. Finally, an island to rest and take water from. How wrong we were, for the water was deep under a massive hole in the soil.'
Parody of the Titicaca Lake

name: Uluru Pit
uniques: Must be adjacent to [1] to [6] [Coast] tiles
Must be adjacent to [0] [Ice] tiles
Neighboring tiles will convert to [Plains]

civilopediaText.text: So delicate, so thinn, so deep. May no ship fall here, may the walls don't collapse.
Parody of the Uluru

name: UnOasis
uniques: Rare feature
Rough terrain
Only [All Road] improvements may be built on this tile
Neighboring tiles will convert to [Dry Plains]
Units ending their turn on this terrain take [10] damage
Considered [Undesirable] when determining start locations

civilopediaText.text: A work of the devil, how can this spot on the ground delete all the water it comes across?

name: Dry Plains
uniques: Doesn't generate naturally

civilopediaText.text: Dried up out of water, who could possibly live here?
